definition: every beginning is difficult (idiom)/getting started is always the hardest part
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

sentences.english: My business is in the beginning phases, and everything is always hard in the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我的事业在刚刚起步当中，不说万事开头难吗？

sentences.english: Beginning is difficult for everything, let us study hard , more practice , more better.
sentences.chinese: 万事开头难，让我们如力学习，越实践越好。

sentences.english: There's a first time for everything. You know what I mean?
sentences.chinese: 万事开头难。你明白我的意思吧？

sentences.english: “At first it was difficult, ” he confessed.

definition: there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上无难事，只怕有心人

definition: lit. nothing is difficult on this earth, if your mind is set (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 天下无难事，只怕有心人

definition: Failure is the mother of success.
pinyin: shi1 bai4 shi4 cheng2 gong1 zhi1 mu3

definition: towering buildings are built up from the ground (idiom)/great oaks from little acorns grow
pinyin: wan4 zhang4 gao1 lou2 ping2 di4 qi3

definition: lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step/fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: to start from scratch
with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect
lit. ninety li is merely a half of a hundred li journey (idiom)/fig. the closer one is to completing a task, the tougher it gets/a task is not done until it's done
pinyin: xing2 bai3 li3 zhe3 ban4 jiu3 shi2

definition: lit. When we get to the mountain, there'll be a way through. (idiom)/fig. Everything will turn out for the best./Let's worry about it when it happens./It will be all right on the night./cf couplet 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: che1 dao4 shan1 qian2 bi4 you3 lu4

definition: easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)

If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
related.word: 只要功夫深，铁杵磨成针

definition: to press on
